revised_title: Field and Laboratory Studies of the Rheology of Mount Etna Lava
tldr: This article presents field and laboratory studies on the rheology of Mount Etna lava, focusing on viscosity measurements and the behavior of the lava during the 1971 eruption. The researchers used two methods to estimate viscosity: flow rate measurements and a ballistic method with a steel spear. They found that the flow behavior and viscosity can vary significantly from lava to lava, depending on factors like temperature, composition, crystal and bubble content, and cooling history. The study provides valuable insights into the understanding of volcanic processes and the behavior of lava flows.
